title: Deciphering Functions of Neurons in Vision-Language Models
author: Jiaqi Xu (University of Science and Technology of China), Cuiling Lan (Microsoft Research Asia), Xuejin Chen (University of Science and Technology of China), Yan Lu (Microsoft Research Asia), ...
relevance_why: The insights into neuron functions in vision-language models can enhance multimodal integration in Dr. Liu's audio-based projects, particularly in synchronizing audio with visual elements.
background: This paper investigates neuron functions in vision-language models to understand how these neurons respond to visual and text data, aiming to improve interpretability and transparency.
contribution: This paper introduces a framework to automatically explain individual neuron functions in vision-language models, achieving enhanced interpretability and workflow automation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly focused on automatic explanations for language models but did not adequately address vision-language models' unique challenges.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs neural activation observations combined with a framework utilizing GPT-4o for automated interpretation, specifically tailored to handle both visual and text modalities.

key_innovation: Introduces an activation simulator to assess the reliability of neuron function explanations, providing a novel way to understand multimodal interactions.
real_world_impact: Enhanced interpretability in vision-language models could foster trust and usability in AI systems, facilitating their application in diverse fields including education and healthcare.
limitations: The exploration may be limited by the black-box nature of large language models, making certain interpretations challenging.

new_terms.vision-language models: **Vision-language models** are AI systems that understand and generate responses based on both visual and textual information, typically used for tasks like image captioning and visual question answering.
